item.title: More than half of the worldwide facial aesthetics market is made up of Botox
item.description:
The global demand for facial aesthetic procedures is growing, driven by consumers who are increasingly interested in their appearance and prefer less invasive treatments, according to a report on the Facial Aesthetics Market from 2016-2020 by Technavio. Technavio’s research shows that Botox holds the largest share of the facial aesthetics market, making up roughly 52% of the total. They attribute this dominance to changing cultural perceptions of beauty, higher disposable incomes, and the growing popularity of the brand...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/more-than-half-of-the-worldwide-facial-aesthetics-market-is-made-up-of-botox/

item.title: Simply smile to make your payment at this KFC restaurant in China
item.description:
A new, digitally connected experience for professionals living in urban areas. For the first time in the world, consumers can pay using facial recognition technology. Yum China Holdings, which owns KFC, has launched a new restaurant concept, KPRO by KFC, in Hangzhou, China â€“ the same city where Alibaba is headquartered. Designed for savvy diners who enjoy trying new things, KPRO offers a fresh and seasonal menu. Using digital technology, it provides an immersive dining experience...
